description: a(n) = min_{k} {T(n,k)} where T(n,k) is the "phi/sigma tug-of-war sequence with seed n" defined by T(n,1) = phi(n), T(n,2) = sigma(phi(n)), T(n,3) = phi(sigma(phi(n))), ..., T(n,k) = phi(T(n,k-1)) if k is odd and = sigma(T(n,k-1)) if k is even.
comments: Conjecture: The sequence {T(n,k)} is eventually periodic for every n, so a(n) can be computed in finite time.Conjecture: a(n) -> infinity as n -> infinity.
example: The sequence {T(5,k)} is 4, 7, 6, 12, 4, 7, 6, 12,..., whose minimum value is 4. Hence a(5) = 4.
mathematica: a[ n_ ] := For[ m=EulerPhi[ n ]; min=Infinity; seq={m}, True, AppendTo[ seq, m ], If[ m<min, min=m ]; m=EulerPhi[ DivisorSigma[ 1, m ] ]; If[ MemberQ[ seq, m ], Return[ min ] ] ]
author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Jan 09 2002
